text:
Question 47) The textile industry uses a large amount of dyes in the tissue dyeing process. The darkening of rivers waters caused by the eviction of these dyes can trigger a number of problems in the aquatic ecosystem. Considering this darkening of the water, the initial negative impact that occurs is the
A) Eutrophization.
B) algae proliferation.
C) Inhibition of photosynthesis.
D) photodegradation of organic matter.
E) Increased amount of dissolved gases.
